thread.title: The EU condemns the arrests and home searches of A. Lukashenka’s opponents earlier than the parliamentary elections
thread.title_full: The EU condemns the arrests and home searches of A. Lukashenka’s opponents earlier than the parliamentary elections

author: archyde
title: The EU condemns the arrests and home searches of A. Lukashenka’s opponents earlier than the parliamentary elections
text:
“The European Union condemns within the strongest attainable phrases the current repressions towards former political prisoners and family of political prisoners remaining in Belarus,” mentioned EU overseas coverage chief Josep Borrell.
“Almost 100 folks had been injured in raids and searches by the regime’s safety equipment, and plenty of of them had been arrested,” he added.
Brussels says Lukashenko is constant his “deplorable techniques of intimidation and repression towards his critics and potential political opponents” within the run-up to February’s elections.
In Belarus, which has been dominated by the autocrat A. Lukashenko since 1994, for nearly 4 years, everybody who participated in mass anti-government protests in 2020 has been brutally handled.
These repressions point out that there shall be no vital opposition within the February 25 vote.
This would be the first election in Belarus because the protests of 2020, and the composition of the decrease home of parliament will rely on it.
Human rights group Viasna mentioned not less than 24 folks had been detained throughout the nation on Tuesday.
“The thugs of the regime focused former political prisoners and the households of presently imprisoned prisoners,” Belarusian opposition chief Svetlana Cichanouskaja mentioned.
The group imposes sanctions on Belarus for its crackdown on the opposition and for permitting A. Lukashenka to make use of his nation’s territory as a springboard for Russia’s assault on Ukraine.
